e="preserve">An algebraic fraction is a fraction where the top and the bottom are algebraic expressions. Two examples of algebraic fractions are formula_1 and formula_1.
A rational fraction is an algebraic fraction where the top and the bottom are polynomials. formula_1 is a rational fraction, but formula_1 is not. This is because the top has a square root function.
